info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 6 at 3:33AM CDT until April 7 at 10:01AM CDT by NWS Little Rock AR
info.description:
...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Arkansas...
Petit Jean River At Danville affecting Yell County.
Fourche Lafave River Near Gravelly affecting Yell County.
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Arkansas...
Fourche Lafave River Near Houston affecting Perry County.
For the Petit Jean River...including Danville...Moderate flooding is forecast. For the Fourche Lafave River...including Gravelly, Houston...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring.
* WHERE...Fourche Lafave River near Gravelly.
* WHEN...Until late tomorrow morning.
* IMPACTS...At 24.0 feet, Portions of Highway 28 effected. Timber and pasture along West Bank floods. Property and livestock should be moved to higher ground.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:45 AM CDT Sunday the stage was 25.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage early this morning and continue falling to 4.2 feet early Friday morning. - Flood stage is 24.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
River forecasts are based on current conditions and rainfall forecasted to occur over the next 24 hours. During periods of flooding...Evening forecasts are reissued with updated rainfall forecasts.
Observed and forecasted stage data plots are available on our Advanced Hydrologic Prediction Service web page at... www.weather.gov/lzk
Under the Current Conditions section...Select River and Lakes AHPS.
The next statement will be issued late tonight at 345 AM CDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW MORNING
